Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Globular bottle
Description: Globular bottle with short cylindrical neck. Body with curved walls and slight curvature indicated by means of undeep fluting. Convex unstable base. Pasta of a cream colour. Exterior surface covered with orangey-coloured coating, partially lost. There is a decoration on the upper third of the body, where a maroon-coloured band runs between wine-coloured horizontal lines. In this band a design appears, consisting of eyes, the traces of which are indicated by means of dark lines.
